li.a: Center ISD Modified Public Comment Regulation
Center ISD Public Comment for Board Meetings Hotline

span.style: font-size: 22.5pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #461d7c;

font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;

p.span: In an attempt to minimize health and safety risks to the Center ISD community, the district has taken the precaution to close schools and offices Tuesday, March 17th through Friday, April 24th while we assess the situation in our community. The district will continue to monitor and evaluate the situation and will communicate across all channels as updated information becomes available.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;

label.span: How can I support my student’s learning and instruction from home?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;

p.span: In order to provide academic support and instruction, Center ISD is distributing instructional materials to students in the form of packets and online content. Please refer to the campus website for specific information.

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;
font-size: 14px;

label.span: What technology resources are available to support learning at home?

span.style: font-size: 18px; color: #000000;

p.span: Prodigy is an interactive game that allows students to work on their math concepts in a fun and engaging way. Students can log in with their school google account.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #000000;

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #000000;

p.span: If students are struggling with problems or concepts, Khan Academy has a lot of information to help. Students can search Math subjects by their grade and find tutorial videos to help them understand the concepts.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #000000;

p.span: No Red Ink is a fun, personalized, and adaptive tool to help students improve their grammar and writing skills. Students can log in to No Red In with their school Google account.

p.span: Students can have access to ebooks they can read free from their device.

p.span: A fun interactive learning environment with games and videos for Reading, Math, & Science.

p.span: Brain Pop teaches a variety of subjects through activities, games, and fun videos. Students can interact and reflect on their learning.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #222222;

p.span: From login credentials contact your teacher.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #222222;

p.span: Let your student learn how to code at their own pace! Students will begin coding by using simple building blocks to accomplish different tasks. As the student progresses they will move from using blocks or puzzle pieces to understand the concepts to actually writing the code themselves. Students will login with their school Google account.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #222222;

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc;

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #222222;

p.span: CodeCombat is an interactive adventure game where students will control their character by typing code. Students will learn code theory and advance to typing their own code. Students can play without logging in or they can keep track of their progress by logging in with their school Google account.

span.style: font-size: 18pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;

label.span: What is CISD doing to control the spread of COVID19?

div.div: DNC Facility Services is cleaning/disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces on a daily basis using the Clorox Total 360 cleaning system. They are also “deep cleaning” the entire district beginning March 18th.

label.span: What can I do to prevent being infected or spreading the virus?

ul.li: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue. If you do not have a tissue, use your sleeve (not your hands).
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
Adhere to the preventative measures as recommended by public health officials, such as limiting interaction and practicing social distancing.

li.a: Visit the CDC website for more information.

label.span: What should I do if I’ve been in contact with someone who has been diagnosed with COVID-19?

ul.li: If you have, or suspect you have, had contact with someone who has COVID-19, call your healthcare provider immediately and describe the contact you’ve had. Please stay home for 14 days after contact occurs. CenterISD will work with each family or staff member impacted during any extended absence due to self-quarantine.

span.span: The campus nurse will contact the parent/guardian and set up time to pick up the medication(s) in the front of the campus where the student attends (i.e., curbside).

label.span: How does the closure affect STAAR testing?

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: #393c3d;

div.span: On March 16th, Governor Abbott announced that the state is waiving the STAAR testing requirement.

div.p:

The District is required by Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act, and the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended, as well as Board policy not to discriminate in such a manner.
